item.title: Cultivate the people too: the system is not a machine
item.description:
Cultivate the people too: the system is not a machine

Maybe you and I are in the same business, of large-scale transformational change. Maybe you also want to make our society better, and the environment on which we depend more resilient. In case you nodded, this piece might be interesting for you.

item.title: One more reason to bring the whole body into the room while facilitating
item.description:
One more reason to bring the whole body into the room while facilitating

If you work with groups of people, and you create learning environments for them, you may have heard statements like these before. Invite the whole self to the workshop; engage with the body; get physical; remind participants that the body is not just what carries our brain from one meeting to the next (my personal favorite so far).

item.title: Backcasting: beginning with the end in mind
item.description:
Backcasting: beginning with the end in mind

The future cannot easily be predicted -but it can be created, which is the best approach for people who hate to predict. We walked along a brief history of the future, and we dug a bit deeper into scenario analysis.

item.title: Scientific and philosophical thoughts behind creating the futures we want
item.description:
Scientific and philosophical thoughts behind creating the futures we want

For the philosophically curios. Beware, it's a long post. (This is the fourth post of a "future" series. Here you can find the first, second, and third). Has this ever happened to you? You are designing an intervention with your client, and can't really tell in objective ways whether it was a success or not.

item.title: Scenarios: much more than informed guesses at the future
item.description:
Scenarios: much more than informed guesses at the future

(This is the second essay of my Futures series. The first post is ) In this blog post we take a deeper dive into the scenario analysis and its evolution from the 70's up until the last decade.

item.title: A brief history of the Future
item.description:
A brief history of the Future

In this post I will share a retrospective of our studies and approaches with the future, over the last 40 years or so, up until the most recent developments, and a few ideas on what could be coming next.
